such spaces to be designated as hereinafter provided it shall be unlawful and a violation of this subsection to park any motor vehicle exceeding 22 feet in length in any parking zone e marking and signing parking spaces  enforcement  am #1587 the judiciary traffic safety and parking committee with the aid of the board of public works shall have markings painted or signs placed upon the curb andor upon the street adjacent to parking zone areas above designated for the purpose of designating markings so established no person shall park any vehicle across any such line or marking or park said vehicle in such position that the same shall not be entirely within the area so designated by such lines or markings the committee shall provide the police department with adequate chalk marking devices so that they may mark the tires of vehicles parked so as to determine the period of time such vehicle is parked in a parking zone f parking times am #1004 the parking limit in all parking zones shall be designated by appropriate signs posted in proximity to said parking zone areas the limited parking in the zone shall apply only from  am to  pm on monday the limited parking shall not be enforced on saturday sunday new years day memorial day fourth of july labor day thanksgiving day and christmas day g citations  am #1587 all police officers acting in accordance with instructions issued by the judiciary traffic safety and parking committee shall report the following 1 the type of vehicle occupying the parking space and has been parking in violation of any of the provisions of this subsection 2 the state license number and make of such vehicle 3 the time such vehicle is parking in violation of any of the provisions of this subsection 4 any other facts or knowledge which is necessary to a thorough understanding of the circumstances attending such violation h reserved  rep #800 i collection of penalties  am #1587 the judiciary traffic safety and parking committee shall designate such collectors and methods as are necessary to properly collect all penalties deposited in the penalty boxes or mailed to or deposited with the city police such collectors shall be only such employees as are now or hereafter designated and duly bonded in a sum not less than $1000 for the faithful performance of their duties the city clerk shall maintain a separate account at all times of such money so deposited all forfeiture fees collected by the police department shall be deposited with the clerk and credited to the forfeitures and fines account j removal of chalk marks prohibited  am #1087 no person shall alter or cause the removal of a regulatory chalk mark as provided in this subsection and the penalty for such violation shall be $25 k farm produce sales  am #1087  #1587 the judiciary traffic safety and parking committee shall designate parking zones that may be used by farm market trucks for the sale of their own agricultural products and an application may be obtained from the city clerk for a yearly permit for a permit fee of $75 and such permit holder is then not limited to the time limitations provided in this subsection l rental spaces  am #1087  #1587 the judiciary traffic safety and parking committee under the direction of the council shall designate parking zones rental spaces and the council by resolution shall adopt a schedule of rental fees for such parking zone spaces and a rental permit therefor shall be obtained from the city clerk designating the spaces and rental and the commission shall obtain and place in such rental parking zone areas appropriate signs informing the public of such areas any unauthorized vehicles in such rental zones shall be removed by the city police and the penalty for violating this paragraph shall be $10 together with the costs of removal of the vehicle twenty four hour parking shall be allowed except as provided for maintenance and snow removal in sec 7051 and 2 of this chapter m other parking regulations apply this subsection shall be deemed to be in addition and supplementary to and not in conflict with nor a repeal of prior or existing ordinances of the city but shall be an additional provision for the regulation of traffic and parking in those zones provided for herein n parking on crystal court  cr #2395 1 no person shall park a motor vehicle on the south side of crystal court between the hours of  am and  pm 2 no person shall park a motor vehicle on the north side of crystal court for a period of time in excess of 2 hours between the hours of  am and  pm 5 miscellaneous parking restrictions a street maintenance whenever it is necessary to clear or repair a city roadway or any part thereof the street department shall post such highways or parts thereof with signs bearing the words no parkingstreet maintenance work such signs shall be erected at least 2 hours prior to the time that street maintenance work is to be commenced no person shall park a motor vehicle in violation of such signs b parking in driveways no person shall park or leave standing any motor vehicle in any private driveway without the permission of the owner or lessee of the property upon which such driveway is located whether or not such driveway is posted to limit or restrict parking c parking heavy vehicles in residential district no operator of a motor truck trucktractor trailer or semitrailer or any other vehicle or combination of vehicles other than motor buses weighing more than 6000 pounds shall park such vehicle on any highway other than a routed state trunk highway in any residential district except for such time as is reasonably necessary to facilitate the loading or unloading of the vehicle d night parking restrictions when signs have been erected at or reasonably near the corporate limits as provided in 34913 wis stats no person shall park any vehicle for a period of time longer than 30 minutes between the hours of  am and  am e emergency vehicle parking  cr #2500 on the south side of union street between washington street and the alley parking shall be restricted to authorized emergency vehicles only as indicated by official traffic signs 6 unlawful removal of parking citations no person other than the owner or operator thereof shall remove a city parking ticket from a motor vehicle 7 removal of illegally parked vehicles am #899 any vehicle parked or left standing upon a highway street or alley or other public grounds in violation of any of the provisions of this section or sec 701 of this chapter is declared to be a hazard to traffic and public safety such vehicle shall be removed by the operator upon request of any police officer to a position where parking stopping or standing is not prohibited any police officer after issuing a citation for illegal parking stopping or standing of an unattended vehicle in violation of this chapter is authorized to remove such vehicle to a position where parking is not prohibited the officer may order a motor carrier holding a permit to perform vehicle towing services a licensed motor vehicle salvage dealer or a licensed motor vehicle dealer who performs vehicle towing services to remove and store such vehicle in any storage garage or rental parking grounds or any facility of the person providing the towing services in addition to other penalties provided by sec 716 of this chapter the owner or operator of a vehicle so removed shall pay the cost of towing and storage the owner of the vehicle removed shall pay the reasonable charges for moving or towing or any storage involved  the amount the city charges the owner shall not exceed $55 for towing or moving and $15 per day for storage these charges may be changed by the council by subsequent ordinance resolution or order 8 registration record of vehicle as evidence when any vehicle is found upon a street or highway in violation of any provision of this chapter regulating the stopping standing or parking of vehicles and the identity of the operator cannot be determined the owner as shown by the ownership registration of the vehicle supplied by the wisconsin department of transportation or a comparable authority of any other state shall be subject to the appropriate penalty 9 penalties cr #1197  rep & recr #800 a penalties nonmoving violations am #08162016 any violations of the parking regulations may be enforced by the issuance of a parking ticket the police officer or enforcement officer shall attach to the vehicle parking in violation of this section a notice to the owner or operator thereof that such vehicle had been parked in violation of a provision of this section the forfeitures shall be paid within 7 days of issuance and are as follows 1 overtime parking  a first offense $5 b second offense same day $12 c third offense same day $15 2 other offenses  a for private property double parking blocking alley night parking restrictions snow removal fire hydrant no parking zone wrong side blocking sidewalk or any other miscellaneous violation of these regulations $15 b for parking in an area reserved for handicapped disabled or other violations related to handicapped parking areas the forfeiture is $75 and a parking ticket may be used to enforce these regulations all forfeitures are doubled if not paid within 7 days of issuance a person who has been issued a parking ticket may request a hearing regarding such violation by providing written notice to the city police within 10 days of issuance the person then shall be issued a summons and citation for a violation of this section subject to sec 701 and 25041 of this a timely request for a hearing is not filed the ticket shall be presumed to be uncontested any ticket not paid within 10 days is subject to sec 25041 of this par b below relating to suspension of vehicle registration b suspension of vehicle registration am #1605 pursuant to the provisions of 345284 wis stats the city elects to participate in the nonmoving traffic violation and registration program administered by the wisconsin department of transportation and pay the costs established by the department under 8513 wis stats a fee of $25 shall be assessed against the person violating the nonmoving traffic ordinances for the cost of administering the traffic violation and registration program pursuant to 345284 wis stats the city may request the department to suspend the registration of the vehicle involved or refuse registration of any vehicle owned by the person charged with a nonmoving traffic violation who has failed to pay the applicable forfeiture or otherwise lawfully respond to a citation the chief of police shall be responsible for complying with the requirements of 34528 wis stats 706  abandoned vehicles  1 abandonment of vehicles prohibited no person shall abandon any vehicle unattended within the city for such time and under such circumstances as to cause the vehicle to reasonably appear to be abandoned 2 definition as used in this section vehicle means a motor vehicle trailer semitrailer or mobile home as defined in sec 701 of this chapter whether or not such vehicle is registered under ch 341 wis stats 3 presumption of abandonment any vehicle left unattended for more than 24 hours on any public street or grounds or on private property where parking is prohibited limited or restricted without the permission of the owner or lessee is deemed abandoned and constitutes a public nuisance  provided that the vehicle shall not be deemed abandoned under this section if left unattended on private property out of public view by permission of the owner or lessee 4 exceptions am #289 this section shall not apply to a vehicle in an enclosed building a vehicle in an appropriate storage place or depository maintained in a lawful place and manner authorized by the city or a vehicle parked in a paid lot or parking space 5 removal and impoundment or sale any vehicle found abandoned in violation of this chapter shall be impounded by the police department until lawfully claimed or disposed of as provided in this section if the chief of police or hisher duly authorized representative determines that towing costs and storage charges for 10 days as provided in sub 6 below would exceed the value of the vehicle the vehicle may be junked or sold prior to the expiration of the impoundment period upon determination by the chief of police that the vehicle is not wanted for evidence or any other reason provided that vehicles in excess of 19 model years of age shall be sold or disposed of only by auction sale or sealed bid in accordance with sub 8 below 6 minimum impoundment period the minimum period of impoundment or storage of a vehicle found in violation of this section shall be 10 days 7 notice to owner the police officer removing or causing the removal of any vehicle found in violation of this section shall immediately notify the chief of police of the abandonment and location of the impounded vehicle and shall within 10 days thereafter notify the owner and lienholders of record by certified mail of the impoundment and of their right to reclaim the vehicle the notice shall set forth the information contained in 342403 wis stats and shall state that the failure of the owner or lienholders to exercise their right to reclaim the vehicle shall be deemed a waiver of all right title and interest in the vehicle and a consent to sale of the vehicle 8 sale each retained vehicle not reclaimed by the owner or lienholder may be disposed of by sealed bid or auction sale as provided in 342403 wis stats 9 sale to bar claims against vehicle the sale of a motor vehicle under the provisions of this section shall forever bar all prior claims thereto and interest therein except as hereinafter provided 10 purchaser to remove vehicle am #899 the purchaser of any vehicle on sealed bid or auction sale under sub 7 above shall have 10 days to remove the vehicle from the storage area upon payment of a storage fee of $15 for each day the vehicle has remained in storage after the second business day subsequent to the sale date ten days after the sale the purchaser shall forfeit all interest in the vehicle and the vehicle shall be deemed to be abandoned and may be again sold 11 request for list any listing of vehicles to be sold pursuant to this section shall be made available by the city clerk to any interested person or organization who makes a written request therefor for a fee of $5 12 notice to department within 5 days after sale or disposition of a vehicle under this section the city clerk shall advise the wisconsin department of transportation of such sale or disposition on a form supplied by the department 13 owner may file at any time within 2 years after the sale of a motor vehicle as provided herein any person claiming ownership of such motor vehicle or a financial interest therein may present a claim to the council setting forth such facts as are necessary to establish such ownership or interest and that the failure of the claimant to reclaim the vehicle prior to sale was not the result of the neglect or fault of claimant if the council is satisfied as to the justice of such claim it may allow the same but in no case shall the amount allowed exceed the sum paid into the city treasury as the result of the sale of such motor vehicle nor the amount of interest of the claimant therein 14 exemption any owner or person operating a registered vehicle which shall become disabled or inoperative for any reason and who shall be unable to cause removal of such vehicle from any alley street highway or public place not otherwise regulated as a restricted parking stopping or standing zone shall within 12 hours of such occurrence notify the police department of the location of the vehicle and shall transfer and deliver clear title for said vehicle to the city together with a fee of $25 to offset the cost of towing and junking charges and shall be exempt from the provisions of this section when so requested by the owner or person in charge of a vehicle the chief of police shall be authorized to order such vehicle removed and junked directly from the scene of disablement by the department of public works or the contractor engaged by the city for towing of disabled vehicles the provisions of sub 11 above shall apply to any vehicle removed under this subsection 15 owner responsible for impoundment and disposal costs cr #899 the owner of any abandoned vehicle except a stolen vehicle is responsible for the abandonment and all costs of impounding and disposing of the vehicle costs not recovered from the sale of the vehicle may be recovered in a civil action by the city against the owner the amount the city charges the owner shall not exceed $55 for towing or moving and $15 per day for storage these charges may be changed by the council by subsequent ordinance resolution or order 707  accident reports  1 operators to file am #389 the operator of any vehicle involved in an accident resulting in injury to or death of any person any damage to stateor other governmentowned property except a stateor other governmentowned vehicle to an apparent total extent of $200 or more or total damage to property owned by any one person or to a stateor other governmentowned vehicle to an apparent extent of $500 or more shall within 10 days after such accident file with the city law enforcement department a copy of the report required by 34670 wis stats 2 reports confidential accident reports filed under this section shall be for the confidential use of the department and shall not be open to public inspection except as permitted by 34673 wis stats such reports shall not be used as evidence in any trial or proceeding 708  disorderly conduct with a motor vehicle  rep & recr #0704 1 no person in a motor vehicle shall in a private or public place engage in disorderly conduct under circumstances in which such conduct tends to cause or provoke a disturbance 2 disorderly conduct includes but is not limited to a unnecessary and annoying noises made with a motor vehicle by squealing tires by excessive acceleration of the engine or by emitting unnecessary and loud muffler noises b endangering the safety of hisher own person or property or the safety of anothers person or property by the operation of a motor vehicle c conduct done with no apparent reason or intent other than to intentionally annoy another d using the vehicle horn other than as a reasonable warning or making any unnecessary or unreasonable loud or harsh sounds by means of a horn or other warning device e loud or unnecessary noises or vibrations of any kind 3 a motor vehicle includes but is not limited to an automobile truck motorcycle atv snowmobile and other overtheland vehicles 709  school bus warning lights  am #1710 notwithstanding the provisions of 346482b2 wis stats adopted by reference in sec 701 of this chapter to the contrary school bus operators shall use flashing red warning lights in residential and business districts when pupils or other authorized passengers are to be loaded or unloaded at any location 710  parking during snowstorm emergency  1 emergency declarations am #1399 the council hereby declares that an emergency exists in the city whenever a snowfall during any period of 24 hours or less reaches a depth of 3 inches or more as reported by the us department of commerce weather service such emergency is declared to be a serious public hazard impairing transportation and public health safety and welfare until such time as snow removal operations have been declared completed by the director of public works 2 parking regulations during snow emergencies whenever an emergency exists and the director of public works shall have caused announcement thereof to be made by the radio stations whose normal operating range covers the city no person shall park or suffer to be parked any vehicle of any kind or description in an area marked by temporary no parking signs or between the hours of  pm and  am inclusive upon any street in the city  provided that notwithstanding such emergency restrictions vehicles may be parked for a period of time not longer than 3 minutes for actually loading or unloading of passengers or 30 minutes for actually loading or unloading of property and provided further that no other regulation restricting parking as to place time or manner is violated thereby 3 authorization of erection of no parking signs pursuant to the provisions of 16623 wis stats the director of public works is authorized to erect temporary no parking signs during the existence of an emergency created by a snowstorm or excessive snowfall which impairs or prevents the full use of any highway street or roadway for transportation 4 snow towaway zones rep & recr #1399 the director of public works is hereby authorized to cause the towing away of vehicles parked in violation of this section the owner of the vehicle removed shall pay the reasonable charges for moving or towing or any storage involved  the amount the city charges the owner shall not exceed $55 for towing or moving and $15 per day for storage these charges may be changed by the council by subsequent ordinance resolution or order also the owner of the vehicle shall be subject to prosecution and penalty as provided in secs 716 and 717 of this chapter 5 penalty am #1399 notwithstanding any other provision of this any person violating the provisions of this section shall forfeit not less than $10 nor more than $200 plus any applicable assessments and court costs and upon failure to pay any forfeiture assessment and court costs imposed the court shall order imprisonment or suspension of operating privileges or any other penalty permitted by law for the nonpayment of forfeitures the basic forfeiture for a first offense shall be $150 plus costs however any person who provides proof to the issuing agency that heshe has paid the storage and towing charges prior to the due date of the forfeiture shall have the forfeiture reduced to $10 plus costs 711  traffic and parking regulations on school district grounds  pursuant to the provisions of  wis stats the following regulations shall apply to the grounds of the waupaca school district located within the city 1 parking all parking on grounds of the waupaca school district from  am to  pm shall be by permit only and shall be restricted to areas designated for parking by the school board when signs are erected by the school board giving notice of such restrictions no person shall park a motor vehicle in an area other than one for which heshe shall have been issued a permit nor without displaying a valid permit all authorized visitors shall park only in areas designated and signed for visitor parking 2 speed limits no person shall at any time operate a motor vehicle upon the waupaca school district grounds at a speed in excess of 5 miles per hour 3 vehicles prohibited at specified times no person shall at any time operate a motor vehicle other than a school bus in or upon any drive designated for buses only by sign during the hours of  am to  am and during the hours of  pm to  pm on any week day during the months school is in session 4 one way traffic no person shall operate a motor vehicle contrary to the one way traffic signs posted on any school drive 712  operation and parking of motor vehicles in public parking lots  rep & recr #2496 1 unlicensed operators prohibited no person who does not hold a valid operators license shall operate a vehicle in any public parking lot or in any private parking lot held out for the use of parking for the general public 2 traffic regulations applicable all provisions of sec 701 of this chapter and of the wisconsin statutes and laws incorporated herein by reference shall be applicable on any public parking lot and on any private parking lot held out for use of the general public for parking or vehicular travel 3 parking regulations am #0314 a the existing municipal parking lots are hereby numbered and located as follows 1 lot one southwest corner of south washington street and east union street and the southeast corner of south franklin street and east union street 2 lot two surface lot located at 209 west fulton street 3 lot three southeast corner of north washington street and granite street 4 lot four rotary riverview park east of north main street along cooper street 5 lot five city hall b it shall be unlawful to park any motor vehicle in parking lots numbered one 3 or 4 between the hours of  am and  am unless the operator has obtained and properly displayed a valid city overnight parking permit c it shall be unlawful to park any motor vehicle in parking lots 2 or 5 between the hours of  am and  am d overnight parking permits am #897  #2705 overnight parking permits for municipal parking lots shall be issued by the city clerk permits shall be issued on october 1 of each year and expire on september 30 of the next year the annual permit fee commencing  shall be $72 commencing  and thereafter the annual permit fee shall be $120 no prorated permit fee shall be permitted the permit must be displayed in the vehicle as required by the permit application so that it is plainly visible from outside the motor vehicle the permit fee is nonrefundable the parking permit may be transferred to another person for use on a different vehicle provided the following conditions are met 1 the original permit must be removed from the window of the vehicle and all remaining parts of the original permit must be surrendered to the city clerks office 2 a $2 transfer fee shall be paid to the clerks office and a transfer form shall be completed and signed by the original permit holder and the transferee 3 a permit application shall be completed by the transferee a new permit shall then be issued to the transferee which shall be valid for the remaining portion of the permit year e license requirements no overnight parking permit shall be issued unless the applicant has a valid drivers license the motor vehicle is currently registered and licensed and the motor vehicle is operable no overnight parking permits shall be issued to any vehicle deemed by the chief of police or the director of public works to be too large to be parked safely in a single parking stall f as a condition to the issuance of an overnight parking permit the owner shall agree to the following requirements 1 upon verbal request by the city the owner of the vehicle shall have 2 hours to remove the vehicle from the city parking lot to allow for snow removal services to be performed 2 any owner who fails to remove hisher vehicle within said 2hour time period shall be responsible for and agrees to pay the city for all towing charges incurred by the city 3 any motor vehicle that uses any city lot may not remain parked for more than one week without being operated outside the lot 4 continual storage of a motor vehicle in any city lot for more than one week is prohibited and upon 24hour written notification on the vehicle by the city will be towed from the lot if not removed by the owner 5 all expenses incurred by the city for moving towing or storage services shall be reimbursed to the city by the vehicle owner the amount the city charges the owner shall not exceed $55 for towing or moving and $15 per day for storage these charges may be changed by the council by subsequent ordinance resolution or order am #899 g the police chief and the director of public works or their designees shall administer the permit system established by this subsection and shall make any determinations regarding compliance and the applicability of this subsection h this subsection does not apply to any city parking lots which are leased to private entities the terms and conditions of said lease control those parking lots i penalty am #899 any person who shall violate any provision of this subsection shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $50 nor more than $200 together with any assessments and court costs and shall be responsible to reimburse the city for any moving towing or storage charges however any person who provides proof to the issuing agency that heshe has paid the moving towing and storage charges prior to the due date for the forfeiture shall have the forfeiture reduced to $10 plus costs 4 all of the provisions of sec 706 of this chapter prohibiting abandoned vehicles apply to cityowned parking lots all of the provisions of sec 710 of this chapter prohibiting parking during snow emergencies apply to cityowned parking lots in addition to the regulations set forth in sub 3f above 5 the chief of police or the director of public works or their respective designees are hereby authorized to post signs on the cityowned parking lots advising the public of these prohibitions 6 no person may skateboard or rollerblade in the city hall parking lot lot 5 am #198 713  obstruction of railroad crossings  1 time limitations it shall be unlawful to stop any railroad train locomotive or railroad car upon or across any highway or street crossing or to cause obstruction of vehicular traffic on public streets at such crossing by the stopping leave standing switching or otherwise maintaining constant railway use at such crossing longer than 5 continuous minutes or for more than 7 minutes out of any 12 continuous minutes 2 penalty either the owner or any conductor engineer switchman brakeman or other employee or agent in charge of or otherwise responsible for such offending railroad locomotive or car who shall violate the provisions of this section shall upon conviction pay the city a forfeiture of not less than $50 nor more than $150 for each such violation and a violation for each 12minute period shall constitute a separate offense plus the costs of prosecution and in default of payment shall be imprisoned not less than 5 days nor more than 15 days in the county jail 714  snowmobiles  1 state snowmobile laws adopted except as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter the statutory provisions describing and defining regulations with respect to snowmobiles in the following enumerated sections of the wisconsin statutes are hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this section as if fully set forth herein acts required to be performed or prohibited by such statutes are required or prohibited by this section 35001 definitions 35002 operation of snowmobiles on or in the vicinity of a highway 35003 right of way 35004 snowmobile races derbies and routes  public utility exemption  local be filed 35005 operation by youthful operators restricted  safety certification program established 35006 firearms and bows 35007 driving animals 35008 owner permitting operation 35009 head lamps tail lamps and brakes 35010 miscellaneous provisions for snowmobile operation  to  cr #1588 operating a snowmobile while to intoxicated prohibited 35015 accident and accident reports 35017 enforcement 35019 liability of landowners 2 applicability of rules of the road to snowmobiles the operator of a snowmobile upon a roadway shall in addition to the provisions of ch 350 wis stats be subject to 34604 34606 34611 346141 34618 34619 34620 34621 34626 34627 34633 34635 34637 34639 34640 34644 34646 34647 34648 346501b 34651 34652 34653 34654 34655 34687 34688 34689 34690 34691 346921 and 346941 6 6m and 9 wis stats 3 permitting operation by improper persons prohibited no owner or person having charge or control of a snowmobile shall authorize or permit any person to operate such snowmobile who is not permitted under state law to operate such snowmobile or who is under the influence of an intoxicant or a dangerous or narcotic drug 4 operation while under influence prohibited wis stats shall apply to the operation of a snowmobile any place within the city 5 written consent by owner required the consent required under 350106 11 12 and 13 wis stats shall be written consent dated and limited to the year in which the consent is given if the property is owned or leased by more than one person the consent of each must be obtained 715  waupaca municipal airport  regulation of vehicular and pedestrian traffic  1 definitions as used in this section unless the context otherwise requires the words and phrases used shall be defined as follows a airport the waupaca municipal airport b taxiway an area designated or used solely for the taxiing of aircraft except apron areas c runway any hard surfaced area used and designed for the taking off and landing of aircraft d landing strip any area designed and used for the landing and taking off of aircraft e apron an area adjacent to the administrative and business hangar sections of the airport designed and used solely for the parking and servicing of aircraft f tiedown an area designed and used for the parking and tying down and storage of aircraft g vehicle every device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a public highway h emergency equipment ambulances crash rescue and firefighting apparatus and such other equipment as the council may designate as necessary to safeguard airport runways taxiways ramps buildings and other property i service maintenance and construction equipment equipment normally operated by the city andor the civil aeronautics administration on landing areas runways taxiways and peripheral roads for the servicing maintenance and construction of airport facilities and services this definition shall include equipment owned and operated by a contractor performing work on the airport under a contractual agreement with the city 2 regulation of vehicular and pedestrian traffic a operation of vehicles on runways taxiways and ramps  no privately owned vehicle shall enter be driven upon or operated upon any airport runway taxiway ramp tiedown area or any area posted by signs prohibiting the entrance thereon the provisions of this section shall not apply to emergency equipment or service or maintenance and construction equipment when engaged in performing official duties aircraft owners shall be excluded from the provisions of this section relating to tiedown areas when necessary to reach their own aircraft but in doing so they shall not pass over any runway taxiway or ramp and shall proceed tiedown area at a speed not to exceed 10 miles per hour they shall not at any time park a vehicle on any area used for the movement of aircraft b speed of vehicles  no vehicle shall be driven upon any road within the perimeter of the waupaca municipal airport or upon other airport areas in excess of the speed limit posted at the entrance of said airport or within the boundaries thereof if more than one speed limit is applicable nor shall the driver of any vehicle fail to adhere to any sign posted to regulate vehicular traffic on or about the waupaca municipal airport for the safety of the public c pedestrian traffic on airport  no pedestrian shall be allowed beyond the administration area onto the apron or aircraft tie down area unless for the purpose of embarking on or disembarking from an aircraft or unless authorized by the airport manager pedestrian traffic is prohibited in the runway and outlying area of the airport except for those employes of the city county state or federal governments or contractors engaged in airport construction or maintenance work   public works short term work sites  cr #1495 public works department maintenance and minor construction operations lasting 60 minutes or less shall be governed by this section all city employees shall comply with the requirements of 34723 and 34727 wis stats relating to lighting on highway maintenance equipment traffic cones and a minimum of one warning sign shall be used at all work sites they shall be placed in positions conducive to the safety of the traveling public pedestrians and workers this section sets forth minimum standards for normal short term work sites and additional protection shall be provided when special complexities and hazards exist   compression brakes prohibited  cr #2200 1 no person shall use motor vehicle brakes within the city limits which are in any way activated or operated by the compression of the engine of any such motor vehicle or any unit or part thereof this system of braking is commonly referred to as compression braking or a jake brake 2 the director of public works is authorized and directed to post appropriate signs consistent with the provisions of this section 3 any person violating the provisions of this section shall have committed a traffic offense and a penalty shall be imposed as provided in sec 2504 of this penalties  1 forfeiture penalty and assessments am #788 the penalty and assessments for violation of any provision of this chapter shall be a forfeiture as hereinafter provided together with the costs of prosecution and the penalty assessments imposed by 165872a wis stats the jail assessment imposed by 5346 wis stats and the automation fee imposed by  wis stats where applicable payment of the judgment may be suspended by the sentencing judge for not more than 60 days any person who shall fail to pay the amount of the forfeiture costs of prosecution and penalty imposed for violation of any provision of this chapter may upon order of the court entering judgment therefor and having jurisdiction of the case be imprisoned until such forfeiture costs and assessment are paid but not exceeding 90 days 2 other sanctions nothing herein shall preclude or affect the power of the sentencing court to exercise additional authorities granted by the wisconsin statutes to suspend or revoke the operating privileges of the defendant or to order the defendant to submit to assessment and rehabilitation or attend traffic safety school in addition to payment of a monetary penalty or in lieu of imprisonment 3 forfeitures for uniform traffic offenses forfeitures for violations of any traffic regulation set forth in the wisconsin statutes adopted by reference in sec 701 of this chapter shall conform to the forfeiture penalty permitted to be imposed for violations of the comparable state statute including any variations or increases for subsequent offenses  provided however that this subsection shall not permit prosecution under this chapter of any offense for which an imprisonment penalty or fine may be imposed upon the defendant 4 forfeitures for parking violations a forfeitures for uniform statewide parking stopping and standing offenses  minimum and maximum forfeitures for violation of the offenses described in 34651 to 34655 wis stats adopted by reference in sec 701 of this chapter shall be as follows offense forfeiture minimum maximum 346511 improper parking onoff roadway  $2000 $20000 346521 stoppingstanding in prohibited areas  500 4000 2nd conviction within one year  1000 10000 346522 stoppingstanding on highway by grade school  500 4000 2nd conviction within one year  1000 10000 34653 parkingstanding where prohibited  500 4000 2nd conviction within one year  1000 10000 34654 improper parkingstanding of vehicle  500 4000 2nd conviction within one year  1000 10000 346551 parking on left side of highway  1000 10000 346552 parking vehicle for sale on highway  2000 20000 346553 parking on posted private property  1000 10000 2nd conviction within one year  1000 10000 b overtime parking am #289 the forfeiture for violations of the provisions of sub 7054 of this chapter relating to parking shall be as provided in sec 7054m of this chapter each hour during which a violation occurs shall be considered a separate offense c penalty for other parking violations  the penalty for all other parking violations not included under pars a or b above shall be a forfeiture of not less than $5 nor more than $20 5 other violations any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter for which a penalty is not established by subs 1 or 2 above shall be subject to a forfeiture of not less than $5 nor more than $100 717 enforcement  this chapter shall be enforced in accordance with the applicable provisions of the wisconsin statutes and this section 1 applicable court procedures except as otherwise specifically provided by the laws of the state or the provisions of this chapter the traffic regulations in this chapter shall be enforced in the circuit court of waupaca county in accordance with the provisions of  and 346202a and ch 299 wis stats 2 citations a uniform citation and complaint  the wisconsin uniform traffic citation and complaint described and defined in the wisconsin statutes shall be used for enforcement of all provisions of this chapter except those provisions which describe or define nonmoving traffic violations and violations of 34671 wis stats violations of 34671 shall be reported to the district attorney and the wisconsin uniform traffic citation shall not be used in such cases except upon written request of the district attorney b parking citations  the city attorney shall recommend a citation for use in enforcing the nonmoving traffic offenses in this chapter when approved by the council such citation shall be used for enforcement of nonmoving traffic regulations created or adopted by this chapter including violations of nonmoving traffic regulations defined and described in the wisconsin statutes adopted by reference in sec 701 of this chapter and all provisions of secs 705 and 706 of this chapter the citation for nonmoving traffic violations shall contain a notice that the person cited may discharge the forfeiture for violation of a nonmoving traffic regulation and penalty thereof by complying with sub 3b below nonmoving traffic citations may be issued by law enforcement officers or by civilian employees of the police department 3 deposits and stipulations a uniform traffic offenses  1 who may make persons arrested or cited for violation of moving traffic offenses created by this chapter shall be permitted to make deposits and stipulations of no contest or released by the arresting officer in accordance with the applicable provisions of the wisconsin statutes 2 delivery or mailing of deposit and stipulation the deposit and stipulation shall be delivered personally by the person cited or mailed to police department headquarters 3 receipt required the official or person receiving the deposit shall furnish and deliver or mail an original receipt for such deposit to the alleged violator and shall deliver the deposit and stipulation and a copy of the receipt within 3 days to the clerk of courts b nonmoving traffic offenses  1 direct payment of penalty permitted except for overtime parking at meters as provided in sec 7054 of this chapter persons cited for violation of nonmoving traffic offenses described and defined in this chapter may discharge the penalty thereof and avoid court prosecution by forwarding within 3 days of the issuance of the citation to the police department the minimum penalty specified for the violation if not so forwarded the penalty may be discharged by forwarding within 10 days of the date of the citation to the above named office double the amount of the minimum penalty specified when payment is made as provided in this paragraph no court costs shall be charged 2 court prosecution if the alleged violator does not deliver or mail a deposit as provided in subpar 1 above within 10 days of the date of the citation the chief of police shall forward a copy of the citation to the city attorney for prosecution pursuant to law 3 deposits returned to city clerk am #0104 officers receiving deposits for nonmoving traffic violations under this subsection shall pay over such deposits to the city clerk within 3 days of receipt such payment shall be accompanied by an itemized statement for each deposit of the offense charged and the name of the depositor 718  references to wisconsin statutes  1 statutes specifically incorporated by reference whenever this chapter incorporates by reference specific sections of the wisconsin statutes such references shall mean the wisconsin statutes of 197 as from time to time amended repealed or modified by the wisconsin legislature 2 general references general references in this chapter to wisconsin statutory sections or chapters describing or defining procedures or authority for enactment or enforcement of local traffic regulations shall be deemed to refer to the most recent enactments of the wisconsin legislature describing or defining such procedures or authorities 719  weight restriction  cr #0507 no person whether operating under a permit or otherwise shall operate a vehicle in violation of special weight limitations imposed by local authorities on the bridges designated as follows when signs have been erected as required by 349162 wis stats the compliance with regard to the modification designation and signing of the bridge will be in accordance with applicable wisconsin statutes bridge no p680714 shearer street over the waupaca river in the city of waupaca wisconsin be posted with a 45ton weight limit public works 801 official map 802 official map amendments 803 street improvements 804 special assessments for street improvements  special assessments alternate procedure 805 street excavations 806 obstructions and encroachments 807 vehicles likely to damage streets restricted 808 coasting or skiing on streets prohibited 809 snow and ice removal 810 building numbering system 815 penalty 801  official map  1 intent it is the intent of the council to establish an official map for the purpose of serving and promoting the public health safety convenience economy orderliness and general welfare of the community  to further the orderly layout and use of land  to stabilize the location of real property boundary lines  to insure proper legal descriptions and proper monumenting of land  to facilitate adequate provision for transportation parks playgrounds and storm water drainage  and to facilitate the further subdivision of larger tracts into smaller parcels of land 2 official map am #694 the official map shall show the location and extent of all platted and existing streets highways parkways parks and playgrounds within the city as heretofore laid out adopted and established by law there is hereby established as the official map of the city the map dated  recorded in the office of the register of deeds for waupaca county all notations references and other information shown thereon shall be as much a part of this section as though the matters and information thereon were fully described herein 3 changes and additions a the council may change or add to the official map so as to establish the exterior lines of widen narrow extend or close any platted existing proposed or planned streets highways parkways parks or playgrounds b the council shall refer any change or addition to the official map to the plan commission for review and report thereon prior to adoption the plan commission shall report their recommendation to the council within 60 days c a public hearing of parties in interest and citizens before the council shall be required before any changes or additions to the official map are effective at least 15 days notice of said hearing shall be required by publication d changes and additions made by duly approved subdivision plats shall not require a public hearing if the changes or additions do not affect any land outside the area being platted 4 building permits for the purpose of preserving the integrity of the official map a building permit shall be required for any structure or part thereof that shall hereafter be located erected moved reconstructed extended enlarged converted or structurally altered no permit shall hereafter be issued for any building in the bed of any existing or proposed street highway or parkway shown on the official map no permit for the erection of any building shall be issued unless a street highway or parkway giving access to such proposed structure has been duly placed on this map no damages shall be allowed for the taking by any governmental agency for street highway and parkway purposes any building erected in violation of this section 5 municipal improvements no public sewer or other municipal street utility or improvement shall be constructed in any street highway or parkway within the city until such street highway or parkway is duly placed on the official map 6 appeals the board of zoning appeals shall have the power to review any administrative decision of the building inspector to deny a permit for the erection of a structure under this section and to grant relief from the requirements of this section under the provisions of 62236d f and g wis stats 7 certified copy of map there shall be a certified copy of the official map the certified copy shall be kept in the office of the city clerk and shall be available for inspection by any interested person during regular office hours the certified copy shall bear on its face a certification that it is a true copy of the official map described in and accompanying this section and shall show the date of adoption of this section and shall be signed by the mayor and countersigned by the clerk thereafter no change or addition to such official map shall become effective until it shall have been indicated by the appropriate certification on the aforesaid certified copy of the official map and a certificate placed thereon or attached thereto bearing the number and date of adoption of the amending ordinance the certificate shall be signed by the mayor and countersigned by the city clerk 8 map to be filed with register of deeds the city clerk shall be responsible immediately upon adoption of the official map or any amendment thereto for recording a true copy of the amended official map with the register of deeds of waupaca county 9 enforcement it shall be the duty of the building inspector and the chief of police to enforce the provisions of this section 802  official map amendments   193 293 393 1393 1793 2193 1694 2394 2594 296 696 197 297 397 1097 1298 699 1699 1801 see miscellaneous ordinances 803  street improvements  1 to be done by city or by contract all street improvements including all street surfacing and layout of sewer and water mains urban gutters and sidewalks shall be done by city forces or by contract 1a construction or maintenance of streets without competitive bidding cr #596 the city upon recommendation of the board of public works may enter into contracts with waupaca county for the construction or maintenance of streets within the city without competitive bidding the city may also elect to directly perform any construction or maintenance of streets without competitive bidding 2 size of sewer and water mains am #1904 water mains shall be at least 8 inches in diameter and sanitary sewer mains shall be at least 8 inches in diameter 3 sequence of improvements as a general rule it will be the policy to install water and sewer improvements in one year and the curb gutter and street improvements during the following year a hightype bituminous or concrete surfacing shall not be placed on any street until curb and gutter sewer and water with laterals and storm sewer where required are in place 4 connection of laterals no private sewer or water lateral shall be connected with public sewer or water main without a permit therefor issued as directed by the council 5 mandatory installation of laterals whenever the council shall declare its intention to improve any street water and sewer service laterals shall be first laid in such street at the cost of the property fronting thereon from the sewer and water mains to the curb line on either or both sides thereof at such intervals as the city engineer shall direct the board of public works shall annually determine the average cost of installation of sewer and water laterals and report the same to the council the council shall annually by resolution establish such average current costs as provided in  wis stats each such lateral installed shall be charged to each lot or parcel as a special tax and shall be collected as are other taxes on real estate 6 width of street surfacing am #1693  am #1904 all surfacing on streets in residential areas shall be 32 feet in width face to face with the curbing unless the street right of way is less than 50 feet in which case the council shall determine the width where in the judgment of the board of public works because of exceptional circumstances or undue hardship it is unnecessary for the minor street width to be 32 feet a variance may be granted the procedure set forth in sec 1814 of this variances shall be followed and the final action and determination shall be made by the council 7 gutters all curbs shall have an integral 18 inch gutter 8 sidewalks paved shoulders paths and trails cr #2604 a the city upon recommendation of the board of public works shall determine the need for installation of sidewalks paved shoulders paths or trails based on the following criteria 1 roadway vehicle volume and speed limits 2 road classification ie collection roads 3 pedestrian and bicycle volumes 4 direct access to public place ie schools playgrounds commercial areas public buildings etc 5 land uses 6 population density 7 connectivity to other sidewalks paved shoulders paths and trails 8 existence of a sidewalk agreement or development agreement with the city b if it is determined that sidewalks shall be constructed only on one side of the street with all things being equal it is the preference that construction shall be on the north or east side of the street c the cost of sidewalk construction shall be assessed to the adjacent property owner in accordance with sec 804 waupaca municipal shall be no assessment for paved shoulders paths or trails parcels of land located at street intersections shall be assessed an amount based on the average width of the lots for the area 804  special assessments for street improvements  1 sections  and  wis stats respectively to be followed the cost of laying sanitary sewer and water mains streets sidewalks and curb and gutter shall be assessed against the abutting property in accordance with  and  wis stats respectively charges for current services such as snow and ice removal weed elimination street sprinkling oiling and tarring repair of sidewalks or curb and gutter garbage and refuse disposal sewer service and tree care may be imposed against the property served pursuant to  wis stats 2 exceptions a sidewalk replacement when sidewalks are replaced the property owner shall be assessed 12 of the cost b curb and gutter replacement am #1904 when curb and gutter are replaced the city shall pay the entire cost c corner am #1904 parcels of land located at street intersections shall be exempt not to exceed the number of feet of the width of an average lot for the area from special assessments if the sanitary sewer or water main is laid at the same time in both the intersecting streets on which the corner lot or parcel abuts or if there is already a sanitary sewer or water main in one of the streets upon which the lot or parcel abuts at the time of installation of the sanitary sewer or water main for which the special assessment is made pursuant to 3 wis stats the council shall examine each such lot or parcel to determine if application of the exemption stated herein is just and reasonable under the circumstances and if not the council shall alter the exemption accordingly 3 limitations am #1904 the special assessment for installation of water mains shall in no case exceed the per front foot cost of installing an 8inch water main or in the case of a sanitary sewer the cost of installing an 8inch sewer all oversized mains shall be assessed upon the property benefiting on an area basis 4 collection all special assessments levied hereunder shall be collected pursuant to  wis stats as determined by the council 5 interest cr #994 deferred special assessments shall bear simple interest at a rate which is 2% above the citys current borrowing rate   special assessments alternate procedure  cr #497 1 in addition to other methods provided by law special assessments for any public work or improvement or any current service may be levied in accordance with the provisions of this section 2 whenever the governing body shall determine that any public works or improvement or any current service shall be financed in whole or in part by special assessments levied under this section it shall adopt a resolution specifying this intention and the time either before or after completion of the work or improvement when the amount of the assessments will be determined and levied the number of annual installments if any in which assessments may be paid the rate of interest to be charged on the unpaid balance and the terms on which any of the assessments may be deferred while no use of the improvement is made in connection with the property 3 the provisions of  wis stats shall apply to special assessments levied under this section except that when the governing body determines by resolution that the hearing on the assessments be held subsequent to the completion of the work or improvement or the rendering of the service the report required by  wis stats shall contain a statement of the final cost of the work service or improvement in lieu of an estimate of the cost 4 notice of the time and place of the public hearing on any special assessment proposed to be levied and notice of the final assessment and terms of payment thereof shall be given in the manner prescribed by 7a and 8d wis stats 5 any special assessment levied under this section shall be a lien against the property assessed from the date of the final resolution of the governing body determining the amount of the levy 6 any person against whose property a special assessment is levied under this section may appeal therefrom in the manner prescribed by 12 wis stats within 40 days of the date of the final determination of the governing body 805  street excavations am #12152015 1 permit no cut excavation or service connection shall be made within the city of waupaca rightofway unless a permit is obtained from the director of public works or designee 2 fees a a minimum permit fee of $300 shall be charged for any disturbance made within any portion of the rightofway as part of the permit b the fee shall be assessed for each cut excavation trench or service connection made that disturbs any portion of the roadway sidewalk curbs curb and gutter or driveway 3 regulations for filling cuts or excavations a maintain the safety of the traveling public control vehicle and pedestrian traffic using barricades traffic cones or drums warning signs flaggers and temporary barriers as needed in no case shall work be performed that will cut off traffic flow completely except by special permission of the director of public works b all cuts or excavations made in paved areas shall be backfilled with granular material or suitable equivalent as approved by the street superintendent the contractor or utility shall compact all subgrade layers with mechanical compaction equipment in layers not greater than 12 inches base coarse material shall match existing adjacent conditions but shall be no less than 12 inches of 114inch base aggregate dense or equivalent the contractor or utility shall compact base course layers with mechanical compaction equipment in layers not greater than 6 inches unsuitable excavated material shall be hauled away by the contractor or utility and no rocks or old pavement may be deposited within the backfill immediately after backfilling and compacting the contractor or utility doing the work shall notify the street department of the completion of the backfilling c the contractor or utility shall replace all disturbed pavement curbs curb and gutter sidewalk and driveway aprons at its own expense no later than 7 days after backfilling d if a cut is made in an asphalt street hot mix asphalt hma mixture shall be placed to match the existing thickness but shall be no less than 4 inches in total thickness hma material shall be placed in layers not less than 15 inches nor greater than 35 inches after compaction if hma material is unavailable due to seasonal constraints the contractor or utility shall place cold mix asphalt temporarily the cold mix asphalt must be replaced at the expense of the contractor or utility upon availability of hma material e if a cut is made in a concrete street 8 inches of concrete of a mixture of 6 bags of cement to the cubic yard shall be placed and finished off level with and in the same manner as the existing concrete pavement the contractor or utility shall pin all concrete work installed including sidewalk pavement curbs curb and gutter and driveways as approved by the street superintendent if the concrete is not placed within 7 days after backfilling the street department shall replace the concrete and charge the contractor or utility for the cost of such replacement f all boulevards and lawns disturbed by the contractor or utilitys operation shall be restored immediately after backfilling has been completed all such restoration shall be subject to the direction of the street superintendent relating to amount of topsoil type and quality of grass seed use of matting and mulching and amount and ratio of fertilizer all utility locate flags shall be removed by the contractor or utility after work is completed g all curbs curb and gutters sidewalks and driveway aprons disturbed by the contractor or utility operation must be replaced with concrete of a mixture of 6 bags of cement to the cubic yard the concrete shall be placed no later than 7 days after backfill has been completed if not done within this period of time the street department will perform the work and charge the cost thereof to the contractor or utility any portion of a driveway or sidewalks within driveways shall be 7 inches thick with 6 inches of 34inch base aggregate dense or equivalent all other sidewalk shall be 5 inches thick with 6 inches of 34inch base aggregate dense or equivalent all curbs and curb and gutter shall be formed and placed to match existing h if the replaced pavement curbs curb and gutter sidewalk or driveway apron settles or cracks within one year of the date of the permit and if failure of the replacement is due to improper backfill compaction or material usage  the street department shall replace all defective work and charge the contractor or utility for the cost of such replacement 806  obstructions and encroachments  1 prohibited no person shall encroach upon or in any way obstruct or encumber any street alley sidewalk public grounds or land dedicated to public use or any part thereof or permit such encroachment or encumbrance to be placed or remain on any public way adjoining the premises of which heshe is the owner or occupant except as provided in sub 2 below 2 exceptions the prohibition of sub 1 above shall not apply to the following a trees and branches which do not extend below any point 8 feet above the sidewalk or 10 feet above a street or alley b public utility encroachments duly authorized by state law or by the council c goods wares merchandise or fixtures being loaded or unloaded which do not extend more than 3 feet on a sidewalk provided such goods wares etc do not remain thereon for more than 3 hours d racks or platforms for the display of merchandise at least 18 inches above the sidewalk and extending not more than 24 inches from the building to which attached e building materials under permit from the council which shall not obstruct more than 12 of the sidewalk or more than 13 of the traveled portion of the street and shall not interfere with flow in the gutters the council shall require that any such building materials be protected by lighted and reflective barricades am #1904 f goods wares merchandise or fixtures on the sidewalks of the blocks of main street between its intersection with badger street and granite street  provided however that there is an unencumbered space 5 feet wide on the sidewalks on the block from badger street to union street on the east side of main street and provided there is an unencumbered space 7 feet wide on the sidewalks on the remaining blocks of main street as above set forth effective upon adoption and publication according to law cr #1188  am #1903 807  vehicles likely to damage streets restricted  no vehicle having lugs or cleats on the wheels or being so heavy or so heavily loaded as to endanger the surface of streets or alleys shall be operated thereon without a permit from the street superintendent which permit shall specify the route to be taken by such vehicle heshe may require the removal from any such vehicle any flanges cleats or other removable parts which would damage the street and may also require that planks or other sufficient protection for the streets be provided by the person operating such vehicle 808  coasting or skiing on streets prohibited  no person shall coast or ski on any of the streets or alleys of the city or attach a coasting or skiing vehicle to another vehicle to be towed on any street or alley within the city 809  snow and ice removal  1 responsibility of owner or occupant the owner or occupant of a lot or parcel abutting on a sidewalk within the city shall clear said sidewalk of snow or ice to the width of the sidewalk within 24 hours of the cessation of any snowfall if ice forms so that it cannot be removed such person shall keep the sidewalks sprinkled with a material which will reduce the risk to pedestrians of slipping and falling on such sidewalk snow not timely removed and ice not timely removed or sprinkled shall be deemed a public nuisance as provided in sec 100513 of this 2 removal of snow and ice by city rep & recr #782  am #1904 in the event the owner or occupant fails to remove snow or ice in conformity with this section the director of public works may direct city employees to remove such snow and ice and charge the cost thereof as a special tax against the property the cost shall be based on time materials and overhead expense 3 plowing snow onto streets prohibited the owner or lessee of every lot or parcel in the city shall not by himselfherself or hisher agent push plow or otherwise deposit snow from within hisher lot line onto the public street or alley 810  building numbering system  1 there is hereby established a uniform system of numbering houses and buildings fronting on all streets avenues and public ways in the city and all houses and buildings shall be numbered in accordance with the provisions of this section 2 east and west fulton streets and their extensions shall constitute the base line for numbering along all streets running north and south and main street and its extensions shall constitute the base line for numbering all streets running east and west 3 the numbering for each street shall begin at the base line the numbers in the first block shall be from 100 to 199 the second block 200 to 299 the third block 300 to 399 etc there shall be assigned 100 numbers to each block square or space that would be one block or square if streets each way were so extended as to intersect each other and one number shall be assigned to each 20 feet of frontage in blocks or equivalent space longer than 1250 feet which is not intersected by a street the total length of space divided by 50 shall be used to determine the feet of frontage to be assigned each number 4 all lots and houses shall be numbered with even numbers on the right side of the street commencing at the base line and all lots and houses shall be numbered with odd numbers on the left side of the street commencing at the base line each commencing with the hundred assigned to that block and shall increase from the base line one number for each 20 feet of frontage or fraction thereof except as provided in sub 3 above where any building has more than one door serving separate occupants a separate number shall be assigned to each door serving a separate occupant providing the building is 25 feet or more in width if the building is not 25 feet or more in width and the entrances are not that far apart the next consecutive number shall be marked fractional buildings fronting on 2 or more streets shall have a number fronting on the main entrance unless other entrances serve other occupants 5 all streets not extending the base line shall be assigned the same relative numbers as if the said street had extended to the said base line 6 building numbers a the council has caused a survey to be made and there is hereby assigned to each house and building located on any street alley highway or avenue in the city its respective number under the uniform system provided for in this section as shown on the map attached to and made a part of this section within 60 days after notice by the building inspector the owner occupant or agent shall place or cause to be placed upon each house or building controlled by himher the number or numbers assigned under the uniform system provided for in this section b the numbers shall be conspicuously placed immediately above on or at the side of the proper door of each building so that the number can be seen plainly from the street whenever any building is situated more than 50 feet from the street line the number of such building shall be conspicuously displayed in an appropriate place so as to be easily discernible from the sidewalk 7 where only one number can be assigned to any house or building the owner occupant or agent of such house or building who shall desire distinctive numbers for the upper and lower portion of any such house or building or for any part of such house or building fronting on any street may use the suffix a b c etc as may be required 8 for the purpose of facilitating correct numbering a map showing the proper number of all lots or houses fronting upon all streets avenues or highways shall be kept on file in the office of the building inspector this map shall be open to inspection by all persons during the office hours of the building inspector 9 the building inspector shall inform any party applying therefor of the number or numbers belonging to or embraced within the limits of said lot or property as provided in this section in case of doubt as to the proper number to be assigned to any lot or building the building inspector shall determine the number of each lot or building 10 whenever any house building or structure shall hereafter be erected or located in the city it shall be the duty of the owner to procure the number so assigned upon said building as provided by this section no building permit shall be issued for any house building or structure until the owner has procured from the building inspector the official number of the premises 11 all police officers of the city shall report the violation of any provision of this section 12 if the owner or occupant of any building required to be numbered by this section shall neglect for more than 60 days to duly attach and maintain the proper numbers of such building the building inspector shall cause to be served upon such owner or occupant the notice requiring such owner or occupant to properly number the same and if heshe neglects to do so for 10 days after the serving of such notice heshe shall be deemed to have violated this section 815  penalty  any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter or any order rule or regulation made hereunder shall be subject to a penalty as provided in sec 2504 of this  public peace and good order 901 offenses against state laws subject to forfeiture  video gambling machine exception  possession use and sale of possession use and sale of synthetic cannabinoids prohibited  cr #2110 1 it shall be illegal for any person to use possess purchase attempt to purchase sell publically display for sale or attempt to sell give or barter any one or more of the following chemicals whether under the common street or trade names of spice k2 genie yucatan fire fake or new marijuana or by any other name label or
