affecting peace and safety rep & recr #02152015 1006 reserved rep & recr #02152015 1007 reserved rep & recr #02152015 1008 abatement of public nuisances rep & recr #02152015 1009 cost of abatement rep & recr #02152015 1010 trees shrubs and other vegetation rep & recr #02152015 1011 reserved rep #06182018 1015 penalty 1001  public nuisances prohibited  no person shall erect contrive cause continue maintain or permit to exist any public nuisance within the city 1002  public nuisance defined  a public nuisance is a thing act occupation condition or use of property which shall continue for such length of time as to 1 substantially annoy injure or endanger the comfort health repose or safety of the public 2 in any way render the public insecure in life or in the use of property 3 greatly offend the public morals or decency 4 unlawfully and substantially interfere with or obstruct or tend to obstruct or render dangerous for passage any street alley highway navigable body of water or other public way or the use of public property 1003  public nuisances affecting health  the following acts omissions places conditions and things are hereby specifically declared to be public health nuisances but such enumeration shall not be construed to exclude other health nuisances coming within the definitions of sec 1002 above 1 adulterated food all decayed harmfully adulterated or unwholesome food or drink sold or offered for sale to the public 2 unburied carcasses carcasses of animals birds or fowl not intended for human consumption or foods which are not buried or otherwise disposed of in a sanitary manner within 24 hours after death 3 breeding places for vermin etc accumulations of decayed animal or vegetable matter trash rubbish rotting lumber bedding packing material scrap metal or any material whatsoever in which flies mosquitoes diseasecarrying insects rats or other vermin may breed 4 stagnant water all stagnant water in which mosquitoes flies or other insects can multiply 5 garbage cans and plastic bags garbage cans and plastic bags which are not flytight 6 animals all animals running at large 7 smoke and fumes the escape of smoke soot cinders noxious acids fumes gases fly ash or industrial dust within the city limits or within one mile therefrom in such quantities as to endanger the health of persons of ordinary sensibilities or to threaten or cause substantial injury to property 8 noxious weeds all noxious weeds and other rank growth of vegetation all weeds and grass shall be kept cut to a height not to exceed one foot 9 water pollution the pollution of any public well or cistern stream lake canal or other body of water by sewage creamery or industrial wastes or other substances 10 noxious odors etc any use of property substances or things within the city emitting or causing any foul offensive noisome nauseous noxious or disagreeable odors gases effluvia or stenches extremely repulsive to the physical senses of ordinary persons which annoy discomfort injure or inconvenience the health of any appreciable number of persons within the city 11 street pollution any use of property which shall cause any nauseous or unwholesome liquid or substance to flow into or upon any street gutter alley sidewalk or public place within the city   reserved rep #06182018 editors note of adopted  repealed   former   pertained to feeding of deer prohibited and derived from #3004 similar provisions can be found in reserved rep #06182018 editors note of adopted  repealed   former   pertained to feeding of wild animals in city parks and recreation areas prohibited and derived from #1111 similar provisions can be found in 04  public nuisances offending morals and decency the following acts omissions places conditions and things are hereby specifically declared to be public nuisances offending public morals and decency but such enumeration shall not be construed to exclude other nuisances offending public morals and decency coming within the definition of sec 1002 of this chapter 1 disorderly houses all disorderly houses bawdy houses houses of ill fame gambling houses and buildings or structures kept or resorted to for the purpose of prostitution promiscuous sexual intercourse or gambling 2 gambling devices all gambling devices and slot machines 3 unlicensed sale of liquor and beer all places where intoxicating liquor or fermented malt beverages are sold possessed stored brewed bottled manufactured or rectified without a permit or license as provided for by this 4 continuous violation of city ordinances any place or premises within the city where city ordinances or state laws relating to public health safety peace morals or welfare are openly continuously repeatedly and intentionally violated 5 illegal drinking am #0114 except as provided in sub 6 below the drinking of any intoxicating liquor or fermented malt beverages in violation of state laws and this or the carrying of any open container which contains an intoxicating liquor or fermented malt beverage is prohibited in the following places a on private property without the owners consent b on any street roadway alley parking lot or sidewalk c on any public property in the city d by passengers on a commercial quadricycle as defined under 340018m wis stats 6 license or permit required for premises permitting consumption of fermented malt beverages rep & recr #1397 the prohibition relating to the drinking of fermented malt beverages in any public park street public place or other public area within the city as provided in sub 5 above shall not apply to organizations and groups which have been issued a license or permit as follows a any organization enumerated in 125266 wis stats may be issued a class b fermented malt beverage picnic license pursuant to sec 12023c of this b permits may be granted by the park and recreation department for a picnic or similar gathering of a bona fide fraternal patriotic religious philanthropic veterans recreational social or other similar groups that have been in existence for at least one year permits under this subsection may also be issued to groups of people related by marriage blood or adoption this permit authorizes the consumption and use of fermented malt beverages permits under this subsection shall only be issued in conjunction with the rental of a shelter as provided in city of waupaca municipal sec 18a03 am #0205 1005  public nuisances affecting peace and safety  rep & recr #02152015 the following acts omissions places conditions and things are hereby declared to be public nuisances affecting peace and safety but such enumeration shall not be construed to exclude other nuisances affecting public peace or safety coming within the definition of sec 1002 1 signs billboards etc all signs and billboards awnings and other similar structures over or near streets sidewalks public grounds or places frequented by the public so situated or constructed as to endanger the public safety 2 illegal buildings all buildings erected repaired or altered in violation of the provisions of this to materials and manner of construction of buildings and structures within the city 3 unauthorized traffic signs all unauthorized signs signals markings or devices placed or maintained upon or in view of any public highway or railway crossing which purport to be or may be mistaken as an official traffic control device railroad sign or signal or which because of its color location brilliance or manner of operation interferes with the effectiveness of any device sign or signal 4 obstruction of intersections all trees hedges billboards or other obstructions which prevent persons driving vehicles on public streets alleys or highways from obtaining a clear view of traffic when approaching in intersection or pedestrian crosswalk and which obstruct the clear vision triangle 5 tree limbs all limbs of trees which project over and less than 14 feet above any public sidewalk or less than 20 feet above a street or other public place 6 dangerous trees all trees which are a menace to public safety or are the cause of substantial annoyance to the general public and which may be diseased dead dying cracked or at risk of falling and endanger the life health safety or welfare of the public or its property 7 fireworks all use or display of fireworks except as provided by the laws of the state and this 8 dilapidated buildings all buildings or structures so old dilapidated or out of repair as to be dangerous unsafe unsanitary or otherwise unfit for human use 9 wires over streets all wires over streets alleys or public grounds which are strung less than 15 feet above the surface thereof 10 noisy animals or fowl the keeping or harboring of any animal or fowl which by frequent or habitual howling yelping barking crowing or making of other noises shall greatly annoy or disturb a neighborhood or any considerable number of persons within the city 11 obstructions of streets excavations all obstructions of streets alleys sidewalks or crosswalks and all excavations in or under the same except as permitted by this or which although made in accordance with this are kept or maintained for an unreasonable or illegal length of time after the purpose thereof has been accomplished or do not conform to the permit 12 unlawful assembly any unauthorized or unlawful use of property abutting on a public street alley or sidewalk or of a public street alley or sidewalk which causes large crowds to gather obstructing traffic and free use of the streets or sidewalks 13 snow and ice removal all ice not removed from public sidewalks or sprinkled with a material which reduces the risk to pedestrians of slipping and falling and all snow not removed from public sidewalks within 24 hours after it has ceased to fall thereon see also sec 8091 14 refrigerators all abandoned refrigerators or iceboxes from which the doors and other covers have not been removed or which are not equipped with a device for opening from the inside 15 flammable liquids violations repeated or continuous violations of this the laws of the state relating to the storage of flammable liquids 1006 1007  reserved  rep & recr #02152015 1008  abatement of public nuisances  rep & recr #02152015 1 enforcement rep & recr #04162016 the chief of police the chief of the fire department director of community and economic development or designee officer building inspector director of public works street superintendent and city forester shall enforce those provisions of this chapter that come within the jurisdiction of their respective offices and they shall make periodic inspections and inspections upon complaint to insure that such provisions are not violated no action shall be taken under this section to abate a public nuisance unless the officer shall have inspected or cause to be inspected the premises where the nuisance is alleged to exist and has satisfied himselfherself that a nuisance does in fact exist 2 summary abatement if the inspecting officer shall determine that a public nuisance exists within the city and that there is great and immediate danger to the public health safety peace morals or decency the mayor may direct the proper officer to cause the same to be abated and charge the cost thereof to the owner occupant or person causing permitting or maintaining the nuisance as the case may be 3 abatement after notice if the inspecting officer shall determine that a public nuisance exists on private premises but that the nature of such nuisance is not such as to threaten great and immediate danger to the public health safety peace morals or decency heshe shall serve notice on the person causing or maintaining the nuisance to remove the same within 10 days if such nuisance is not removed within said 10 days the property officer shall cause the nuisance to be removed as provided in sub 2 4 other methods not excluded nothing in this chapter shall be construed as prohibiting the abatement of public nuisances by the city or its officials in accordance with the laws of the state 5 court order except when necessary under sub 2 no officer hereunder shall use force to obtain access to private property to abate a public nuisance but shall request permission to enter upon private property if such premises are occupied and if such permission is denied shall apply to any court having jurisdiction for an order assisting the abatement of the public nuisance 1009  cost of abatement  rep & recr #02152015 in addition to any other penalty imposed by this chapter for the erection contrivance creation continuance or maintenance of a public nuisance the cost of abating a public nuisance by the city shall be collected as a debt from the owner occupant or person causing permitting or maintaining the nuisance and if notice to abate the nuisance has been given to the owner such cost shall be assessed against the real estate as a special charge 1010  trees shrubs and other vegetation  rep & recr #02152015 1 intent it is the intent of this section to exercise jurisdiction in regard to promote maintain and improve the urban forest by addressing planting maintenance and removal of trees shrubs and other vegetation growing in public places in the city the ordinance provides full power and authority over all public trees plants and shrubs and to trees plants and shrubs located on private property that constitute a public nuisance hazard or threat and provide for their abatement 2 definitions in this section unless the context clearly requires otherwise the following words and terms shall have the meaning given herein a city forester the director of public works or designee is the designated city official assigned to carry out the enforcement of this section the director or designee shall be considered the city forester for purposes of this section and any other section of this to trees shrubs and other vegetation b clear vision triangle the triangle generated for a point starting at the street corner rightofway of a private corner lot running 10 feet down each private property line to a point c public area that part of every street highway roadway or alley between the private lot line and the curb or pavement and any other land owned or controlled by the city d public nuisance any tree shrub or other vegetation within the city which is specifically designated a public nuisance in this section or part of which is on public or private property which by reason of its condition interferes with the use of any public place  is detrimental to the construction of public improvements  or endangers the life health safety or welfare of the public or its property e street tree any tree located in a terrace f terrace the part of every street between the private lot line and the curb or pavement line 3 city forester powers and duties it shall be the duty of the city forester under the supervision of the city council to enforce the provisions of this section the powers and duties of the city forester are as follows a the city forester shall have the jurisdiction authority control and supervision over all trees shrubs and other vegetation growing in public areas to include but not be limited to planting removal maintenance and protection to insure safety or preserve the aesthetics of public sites b the city forester shall have the authority to grant approvals under the provisions of this section and rules and work standards adopted hereunder heshe shall supervise all work done under any approval issued under the provisions of this section and may void any approval if the provisions of this section are not complied with c the city forester shall have the authority to cause a public nuisance to be abated in accordance with the provisions of this section upon identifying that a treebushshrub on public property is a public nuisance and must be removed the city shall notify adjacent property owners prior to tree removal the city forester may inspect any trees shrubs vines plants logs or branches existing or growing upon any private or public property within the city the city forester may conduct surveys to determine if any destructive or communicable disease or other pest exists which may be detrimental to or endanger the good health of trees or other plant life in the city d the city forester shall perform such other duties as are provided by the laws rules and regulations of the state particularly 2709 wis stats 4 tree planting requirements a approval required no person shall plant any tree or shrub or other vegetation in a public area without the approval of the city forester b master street tree list the city council shall approve a master street tree list consisting of those trees approved for planting in and on city streets along with a determination of site factors to be considered in selecting trees and placement of such trees for planting on a particular street c improper planting a public nuisance any tree planted in violation of this section shall be deemed a public nuisance 5 tree maintenance a no person shall remove maintain or protect any public tree or shrub or cause such work to be done without obtaining approval from the city forester no approval is required to cultivate water or fertilize any public tree or shrub or take the necessary action to guard the public safety or clear the public way in the event of a storm accident or other emergency b any person desiring to remove maintain or protect any public tree or shrub shall apply in writing to the city forester for approval to do such work the application shall specify the location and description of the proposed work if the city forester determines that the proposed work is necessary and in compliance with the purposes of this section heshe shall approve the work c whenever a public utility or its contractors or any contractor for the city must perform work on or about any public tree or shrub necessitating the alteration above or below ground trimming or removal of such tree or shrub approval from the city forester is required as provided above any person performing work on a tree in a public place by permit contract or otherwise shall assume full responsibility for damage to property and to any person and shall save the city harmless from any liability therefore d all trees and shrubs located upon any public way or upon any private premises adjacent to the public way shall be kept trimmed by the property owner so that the lowest projecting branches provide a clearance height of not less than 20 feet above the public street and not less than 14 feet above the public sidewalk the city forester may waive the provisions of this section for newly planted or naturally lowprofile trees if heshe determines that such trees do not interfere with public travel obstruct the light of any street light obstruct the view of any traffic sign or signal or endanger public safety 6 protection of trees except as approved by the city forester it shall be a violation of this section to perform or cause to be performed the following acts in any public place within the city a to attach any sign poster handbill electrical installation wire or other devise or material to around or tree b to permit or cause fire to burn where it may kill or injure any tree c to allow any toxic chemical smoke oil gas or other substance that may kill or damage any tree to come in contact with its leaves or roots d to use tree spurs or climbers when working on healthy trees e to remove any guard stake pole or other device intended for the protection or stabilization of a public tree or close or obstruct any open space around the base of a public tree designed to permit access to air water and fertilizer f to erect alter repair raze or move any building structure or other large object without placing suitable guards around public trees which may be injured by such operations tree crowns and trunks shall not suffer any branch or bark loss roots shall be protected from compaction storage of materials and severing within a circle around the tree with the tree trunk as the focal point the radius of the tree protection zone tpz shall be determined by the tree diameter listed in the following table tree diameter 45 feet above ground radius of tpz tree trunk in center 04 in 2 feet 419 in 5 feet 9114 in 10 feet 14119 in 12 feet 191 in or more 15 feet roots located within the determined circle shall be protected by such practices as temporary bridges for vehicles or auguring for utility installation any factors that would cause any deviations from the above tale shall be noted on the permit issued for such work and require notification of the city forester it shall be the responsibility of the owner thereof to repair or replace any tree injured or killed by such operations if it is found that the moving of any tree is necessary to allow for such operations the cost of the moving shall be borne by the owner of the project g to excavate any ditch tunnel hole or trench or to place any drive within the radius of 5 feet from any tree in a public area except by approval from the city forester or when an emergency situation exists the city forester may require the posting of an adequate surety bond or other sufficient security by any person proposing to make any such excavation to cover the cost of replacement of any tree destroyed as the direct result of the excavation as reasonably determined by the forester h to damage injure remove or appropriate for ones own personal or private use any tree or shrub procured in whole or in part with public funds or planted or growing in a public area i to prune oak trees on public or private property from april 1 to october 1 except by approval from the city forester if wounding of oak trees occurs during this time under any circumstances a nontoxic tree wound dressing may be applied j violations any person found to disturb the root zone prune remove or cause the removal or death of any public tree shrub or other plant as well as any other violation of without approval of the city forester shall be subject to a forfeiture as identified in sec 2504 k emergencies the mayor with city council approval in the case of emergencies such as windstorms ice storms or other disasters may waive the requirements of this ordinance so that they in no way shall hinder private or public work to restore order in the city 7 planting of other vegetation requirements a approval required no person shall plant any other vegetation except for grass for lawns in a public area without the approval of the city forester b any and all vegetation planted in public areas shall not exceed a height of 24 inches excluding street trees 8 obstruction of view at intersections no person shall plant grow or maintain any tree shrub or other vegetation on any city street corner lot within the private property clear vision triangle which may obstruct the vision of the operator of any motor vehicle or pedestrian approaching such intersection any tree shrub or other vegetation obstructing such view between the heights of 212 feet and 14 feet above street grade shall be deemed a public nuisance 9 public nuisances no person shall permit any public nuisance enumerated in this section to remain on any property owned or controlled by himher including public areas a notice of public nuisance the city forester or designee shall have the authority to inspect or cause to be inspected all premises and places to determine whether any public nuisance as defined in this article exists and shall also inspect or cause to be inspected any vegetation reported or suspected to be infected with disease or insects the city forester may enter upon private premises at all reasonable times for the purpose of carrying out any of the provisions of this article whenever the city forester shall find and declare any tree or part thereof shrub or other vegetation that constitutes a hazard to life or property in the public rightofway or on public property or public nuisance heshe shall notify the property owner or his or her agent in writing that the nuisance must be abated and the procedure required for the abatement if the owner of the property fails or refuses to take remedial action the city or the agent of shall have the authority to enter the property and perform the remedial action without compensation to such owner as well as submit an invoice for payment to be reimbursed by the private property owner to the city for all city incurred expenses if the city forester ascertains that any tree or part thereof or shrub growing on private property is dead declining infected with communicable disease or insect infestation which threatens the health of the urban forest or endangers public or private property the city forester may notify the owner of the property that the tree or shrub must be treated or removed within 30 days of the notification unless it is determined to be an immediate danger to health and safety the following conditions are exemplary but not an inclusive list of matters declared to be public nuisances  1 any dead dangerous or diseased tree 2 any elm tree infected with dutch elm disease fungus or which harbors any carrier of the same 3 any oak tree infected with oak wilt 4 any ash tree infested with emerald ash borer 5 any tree bush shrub or other plant which is infested with and insect or disease capable of infesting other plants b abatement procedure and cost see secs 1008 and 1009 10 noxious weeds and maintenance of vegetation rep & recr #03172017 a purpose it is the purpose of this prohibit the uncontrolled growth of vegetation and to control noxious weeds and invasive species while permitting the planting and maintenance of planned natural landscaping that add diversity and richness to the quality of life there are reasonable expectations regarding the proper maintenance of vegetation on any lot or parcel of land it is in the publics interests to provide standards regarding the maintenance of vegetation because vegetation which is not managed can decrease the value of nearby properties and threaten the public health and safety it is also in the publics interests to encourage diverse landscaping treatments particularly those that encourage the preservation restoration and management of native plant communities which can be economical lowmaintenance and effective in soil and water conservation the city enacts this balance these competing interests cr #03172017 b definitions cr #03172017 destroy means the complete killing of weeds or the killing of weed plants above the surface of the ground by the use of chemicals cutting tillage cropping system or any or all of these in effective combination at a time and in a manner as will effectively prevent the weed plants from maturing to bloom or flower stage cr #03172017 garden means a cultivated area dedicated to growing vegetables and fruits in a welldefined location cr #03172017 native plants means those grasses including prairie grasses sedges solid triangularstemmed plants resembling grasses forbs flowering broadleaf plants that are native to or naturalized to the state of wisconsin native plants do not include weeds cr #03172017 noxious weeds means any plant listed under wisconsin invasive species rule ch nr 40 wis admin  and shall also include but not be limited to the following cr #03172017 1 canada thistle or other thistles cr #03172017 2 english carloc or wild mustard cr #03172017 3 field bindweed commonly known as creeping jenny cr #03172017 4 burdock cr #03172017 5 ragweed cr #03172017 6 poison ivy cr #03172017 7 leafy spurge cr #03172017 8 purple loosestrife cr #03172017 9 stingingburning nettle cr #03172017 10 multiflora rose cr #03172017 11 buckthorn cr #03172017 12 wild parsnip cr #03172017 13 cocklebur cr #03172017 14 pigweed cr #03172017 15 smartweed cr #03172017 16 garlic mustard cr #03172017 ornamental grasses and groundcovers means grasses and groundcovers not indigenous to wisconsin ornamental grasses do not include turf grasses and weeds cr #03172017 planned natural landscaping means a planned intentional and maintained planting of native plants ornamental grasses and groundcovers rain gardens shrubs and trees planned natural landscaping does not include any species of turf grasses and is not intended to allow a property owner to ignore lawn care duties planned natural landscaping does not include gardens cr #03172017 rain garden means a native plant garden that is designed not only to aesthetically improve properties but also to reduce the amount of storm water and accompanying pollutants from entering streams rivers and lakes cr #03172017 turf grasses means grasses commonly used in regularly cut lawns or play areas including bluegrass fescue or rye grass blends or any other similar grasses cr #03172017 c control of noxious weeds cr #03172017 1 as provided in wis stats   the city shall require that all noxious weeds shall be destroyed prior to the time in which such plants would mature to the bloom or flower state cr #03172017 2 any undeveloped parcel larger than one acre in size shall destroy noxious weeds and cut long grass and vegetation to 12 inches in height within the right of way and within 20 feet of any abutting developed property cr #03172017 3 any parcel with improvement upon it or a parcel less than one acre in size shall destroy noxious weeds and cut and maintain long grass and vegetation to a height of 12 inches or less cr #03172017 4 this section shall not apply to cr #03172017 a gardens cr #03172017 b plants located on shoreland within 35 feet of the ordinary highwater mark cr #03172017 c plants located within environmentally sensitive areas such as steep slopes drainage ways wetlands and protective buffer areas or cr #03172017 d planned natural landscaping that is wholly contained within the parcel on which it is planted and maintained cr #03172017 the cost of destroying the weeds shall be charged and assessed in the manner provided by of this code cr #03172017 d requirement of planned natural landscaping cr #03172017 1 turf grass is to be eliminated and the native plants trees and shrubs are to be planted or seed by humans or mechanical means cr #03172017 2 setbacks the setback area shall be regularly cut turf grass trees shrubs mulch wood chips or landscape stone setbacks are distances are defined as cr #03172017 a five feet from front lot line when adjacent to a public sidewalk and 0 feet from front lot line if there is no public sidewalk cr #03172017 b five feet from rear and side lot lines cr #03172017 c no setback is required on side and rear lot lines if any of the following conditions exist cr #03172017 i there is a sighttight fence along the lot lines cr #03172017 ii the native landscaping abuts a neighboring planned natural landscaping area cr #03172017 iii the native landscaping abuts a public park open space cr #03172017 iv the native landscaping abuts a natural area cr #03172017 3 application cr #03172017 a any owner of land in the city of waupaca may apply for approval of a planned natural landscaping where the grasses exceed 12 inches in height and consist of noninvasive native wisconsin vegetation with the community and economic development department cr #03172017 b a planned natural landscaping means site and written plans relating to management of the lawn which contains setback distances of the lawn upon which the plantings will exceed 12 inches of height a statement of intent and purpose for the lawn a description of the vegetation types plants and plant succession involved and the specific management and maintenance techniques to be employed the management plan must include provisions for cutting at a length not greater than 12 inches in the setback area cr #03172017 c when in the opinion of the fire chief the presence of a planned natural landscaping may constitute a fire or safety hazard due to weather and or other conditions the fire chief may order the cutting of the planned natural landscaping to safe conditions as a condition of receiving approval of the planned natural landscaping permit the property owner shall be required to cut the planned natural landscaping within the 3 days upon receiving written direction from the fire chief cr #03172017 e enforcement and penalties cr #03172017 1 upon receipt of a complaint of unmanaged plant growth andor noxious weeds the officer or designee will inspect any lot or property adjacent to or adjoining a lot to review compliance with provisions of this ordinance if violations are noted the officer or designee shall on the first violation of the season notify the party responsible for the property that shall request compliance within 7 days from the date of the notice said notice shall inform the owner that subsequent violations during the current season shall be corrected by the city without further notice if such violation is not corrected within 7 days the city will authorize and conduct action to bring the property into compliance and bill the property owner for such efforts under section 1009 and 2504 the city shall bring the property into compliance and bill the property for each violation thereafter cr #03172017 2 officer or designee shall have the authority to revoke an approved planned natural landscaping permit if the owner fails to maintain the planned natural landscaping or comply with the provisions set forth in this section cr #03172017 11 appeals any person aggrieved by any order or action of the city forester may file a written complaint with the city council the city council shall act upon that complaint at a future regularly scheduled meeting upon providing reasonable notice of the meeting to the aggrieved party cr #03172017 1011  reserved rep #06182018 editors note of adopted  repealed  1011 former  1011 pertained to wild or exotic animals  prohibition on keeping and derived from #1011 similar provisions can be found in 15  penalty  any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter or permit or cause a public nuisance shall be subject to a penalty as provided in sec 2504 of connection to sewer and water 1107 milk and milk products 1108 garbage and refuse 1109 littering water within city prohibited 1115 penalty 1101  reserved  rep #1796 1102  rules and regulations  the finance committee may make reasonable and general rules for the enforcement of the provisions of this chapter and for the prevention of the creation of health nuisances and the protection of the public health and welfare and may where appropriate require the issuance of licenses and permits all such regulations when approved by the council shall have the same effect as ordinances and any person violating any of such regulations and any lawful order of the committee shall be subject to a penalty as provided in sec 2504 of this health nuisances abatement of  am #1795 the building inspector together with the finance committee may abate health nuisances in accordance with 14514 wis stats which is adopted by reference and made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth herein 1104  communicable diseases  am #1795 wis stats and wis adm are adopted by reference and made a part of this chapter and the building inspector and the finance committee shall enforce the provisions thereof 1105  regulation of nuisancetype businesses  1 permit required no person shall conduct within the city any business which has a tendency to create a public nuisance except upon permit issued by the finance committee and subject to such conditions as the committee may impose 2 definition a business which has a tendency to create a public nuisance as defined in sec 1002 of this unless properly regulated 3 authority this section is enacted pursuant to  wis stats 1106  compulsory connection to sewer and water  am #2504  rep & recr #0410 1 all buildings used for human habitation shall be connected with the city sewer and water system if available within 90 days after notice from the building inspector 2 if any property owner fails to comply within 90 days of receiving notice the city may cause such connection to be made and the expense thereof shall be assessed as a special tax lien against the property to be paid in full at the time of assessment if the amount of the assessment is over the amount of $100 the property owner within 30 days after the completion of work may file a written request with the city clerk asking that the assessment be levied as follows an amount from $100 to $500 to be paid in 5 equal annual installments  over $500 to be paid in 8 equal annual installments the amount so assessed shall accrue interest from the date of completion of the work until paid at a rate of 2% per annum over the prime rate which accrued interest shall be collected at the time of payment of each installment 3 in lieu of the above the city at its option may impose a penalty for the period that the violation continues after 10 days written notice to any owner failing to make a connection to the sewer or water system of an amount equal to 150% of the minimum monthly charge for sewer and water service payable monthly for the period in which the failure to connect continues and upon failure to make such payment said charge shall be assessed as a special tax lien against the property all pursuant to 14406 wis stats 4 availability  exemption a sewer and water shall be deemed available if the building used for human sanitation is located on property that is adjacent to a water or sewer main or in a block sewer and water mains extend b in any case that sewer and water is deemed available as provided under para a the property owner may apply to the board of public works for an exemption if the owner believes it to be a hardship to connect to the system c in determining hardship the board of public works shall consider the cost to the property owner to connect or to hookup to the city sewer or water system any adverse effects there may be on the environment caused by the noncompliance with this ordinance and any other condition that may exist at the time the application is made for exemption 5 properties that are serviced by a private sewage system or a private well at the time that this ordinance shall come in force shall not be required to hookup to the sewer system or water system until such sewer system or water system shall fail a a failed private sewage system shall be defined as provided in 4 wis stats b a failed private water system shall be defined as a system that is not in compliance with the department of natural resources standard as provided under wisconsin administrative 07  milk and milk products  1 no person shall sell or distribute milk or any milk product as hereinafter defined for direct human consumption or to any hotel restaurant store vendor or other retailer for resale for human consumption unless such person possesses a valid license therefor granted under sec 1218 of this license shall be required for hotels restaurants stores vendors and other retailers who sell the milk and milk products furnished by licensees in compliance with this section 2 for the purpose of this section the term milk product shall mean and include cream homogenized milk buttermilk skim milk milk beverages skim milk beverages milk or skim milk which have been fortified by the addition of vitamins or minerals 3 it shall be unlawful to sell offer or expose for sale any milk or milk product which is adulterated or misbranded as those terms are defined in the wisconsins statutes 4 it shall be unlawful to sell offer or expose for sale any milk or milk product other than grade a pasteurized milk and milk products as those terms are defined in general order no ag80 5 the building inspector or other person designated by himher shall enforce this section am #1796 1108  garbage and refuse  1 definitions am #590 in this section unless the context requires otherwise the definitions contained in ch 144 wis stats are hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this section as if fully set forth herein any future amendments revisions or modifications of the statutes incorporated herein are intended to be made part of this section a garbage includes all kinds of organic kitchen waste resulting from the preparation of food and all decayed foods and food products from any source whatsoever b refuse includes all waste matter such as ashes tin cans glass rags garden refuse and other items of a similar nature but shall not include leaves trees tree limbs earth stone or manure c commercial waste any refuse that accumulates in or upon property used for wholesale or retail commercial purposes d industrial waste any refuse that accumulates in or upon property used for manufacturing or industrial purposes e hazardous waste any solid waste identified by the state department of natural resources as hazardous under 144622a wis stats f owner includes a person in lawful possession and control of the property or the refuse container 2 keeping of regulated a no person shall deposit throw or place any garbage or refuse on or within any public street alley park sidewalk or other public place or within or upon any private property or premises whether owned kept or controlled by such person or not in the city unless the same shall be placed in containers as hereinafter provided or disposed of mechanical unit connected to a sanitary sewer or interior residential garbage burner b no person shall deposit throw or place leaves trees tree limbs earth stone or manure on or within any public street alley park sidewalk or other public place c no person shall burn or bury any garbage on private or public property in the city but shall cause the same to be collected or disposed of in the manner herein provided no person shall burn any refuse or other material unless same is done in an approved refuse burner or fireplace d all garbage shall be well drained and wrapped securely in newspapers and deposited in containers that shall be kept closed with a tight fitting cover except when being filled or emptied shall be vermin and flyproof and kept in a sanitary condition e all refuse including commercial and industrial waste shall be placed in cans baskets or other suitable containers until disposed of in the manner hereinafter provided and all boxes not used as refuse containers must be broken down flat 3 collection a garbage and refuse collection services shall be maintained upon a voluntary basis with each resident or firm desirous of such services contracting for them as was customary prior to the passage of this section b rep #590 4 disposal a disposal of solid waste  consent of owner required  rep and recr #590 no person shall dump or place any solid waste garbage refuse or ashes on any property in the city without the consent of the owner of such property b unauthorized use of receptacle  general  rep and recr #590 no person shall place or permit another to place any solid waste garbage refuse or ashes in any refuse container in the city without the consent of the owner of the refuse container c unauthorized use of receptacles  cityowned receptacles  rep and recr #590 no person shall place or permit another to place any solid waste garbage refuse or ashes in any refuse container in a city park if such waste is not generated as a result of the use of the park no person shall place or permit another to place any solid waste garbage refuse or ashes in any cityowned refuse containers located on public streets unless such waste is generated incidental to the use of public sidewalks or streets no person shall place or permit another to place any solid waste garbage refuse or ashes in any cityowned refuse containers if such waste is generated from household commercial or industrial sources d no person shall disturb remove or carry away any rubbish refuse or any matter or thing that has been dumped placed or deposited at the sanitary landfill unless approved in writing by the director of public works e the collection and disposal of garbage and refuse as described herein shall be conducted under the supervision direction and control of the director of public works in strict conformity with the provisions of this section and with such additional rules and regulations as may be made from time to time by the finance committee f reserved rep #590 5 disposal of hazardous waste and oil prohibited am # 0104 no person shall deposit hazardous waste or any oil product in the city sanitary landfill site nor set out such hazardous waste or oil product for collection by a licensed garbage collector no garbage collector licensed under sec 1214 of this knowingly deposit any hazardous waste or oil product in the city sanitary landfill site any person desiring to dispose of hazardous waste or oil may contact the city clerk regarding such disposal 6 reserved rep #2989 eff 4190  rerep #590 7 reserved rep #590 8 reserved rep #590 1109  littering water within city prohibited  no person shall #0104 every application for a license or permit required by this chapter shall be made upon a form furnished by the city clerk and verified the appropriate license or permit fee together with a publication fee and cost of background check if any shall be paid to the city clerk at the time of filing such application except that the alcohol beverage license fee shall be paid not less than 15 days prior to the date the license is to be issued 2 license issuance am #0104 licenses when granted shall be issued by the city clerk and shall state the date thereof the day from which it shall be in force the name and place of business of the person to whom it is issued the particular purpose and the time for which issued and the amount of license fee paid the city clerk shall keep all such applications on file and shall keep a record of all licenses issued in the event any license applied for is denied the city clerk shall return the license fee to the applicant 3 license termination except as otherwise specifically provided every license or permit granted under this chapter shall terminate or expire on june 30 of each year 4 no refund of fees no license or permit fee shall be refunded if a license or permit is surrendered or revoked for cause 5 transfer of licenses no license may be transferred unless otherwise provided in this chapter 6 suspension and revocation of licenses except as otherwise specifically provided any license or permit granted under this chapter may be suspended or revoked by the council for cause after giving the licensee or permittee an opportunity to be heard as provided by law 7 delinquent financial obligations to the city cr #792  am #0104 no license or permit shall be granted to any applicant until the city clerk certifies that the applicant has paid in full any financial obligations to the city and that there are no delinquencies financial obligations includes personal property taxes hotelmotel taxes other municipal taxes or assessments forfeitures or other financial claims of the city this subsection applies to the applicants for new licenses or permits and to renewal applicants at the time an application for a license or permit is made the city clerk shall advise the applicant of the provisions of this subsection and shall furnish the applicant with a written notice of all delinquent financial obligations to the city any applicant who contests the city clerks findings that there are delinquent obligations to the city may request in writing a hearing before the council the hearing shall be conducted at the next regularly scheduled council meeting at which time the council shall make a decision to grant or refuse to grant the license or permit at the hearing the applicant may be represented by an attorney and may present evidence and call and examine witnesses and crossexamine witnesses presented by the city an applicant aggrieved by the councils decision may seek judicial review as provided by ch 68 wis stats 1202  intoxicating liquor and fermented malt beverages  rep & recr #583  am #285 1 state statutes and penalties am #1588  rep & recr #893  #1307 a state statutes adopted  wis stats #1307  am #0614 a application for a license to sell or deal in alcohol beverages application for a license to sell or deal in alcohol beverages shall be made in writing on the form prescribed by 125043 wis stats and shall be filed together with the cost of publication as provided by 125043g6 wis stats with the city clerk not less than 15 days prior to the granting of the license however application for licenses to be issued under 125266 and 1255110 wis stats shall be filed with the city clerk not less than 3 days prior to the granting of the license licenses to be issued under 125266 and 1255110 wis stats may be issued by the city clerk and said clerk may authorize the licenses to permit underage persons to be on the premises for which the license is issued further as a condition of granting an operators license the applicant shall permit the city to secure from the federal bureau of investigation and the wisconsin crime information bureau a record check of the applicant no license shall be issued until the fee has been paid b additional requirements for picnic licenses  in addition to those requirements provided under 125266 and 1255110 wis stats for class b fermented malt beverage picnic license and class b wine picnic license the following requirements shall be necessary 1 fencing if necessary due to the physical characteristics of the site the common council may require that organizations install a fence around the main point of sale to control ingress and egress and continually station a licensed operator security guard or other competent person at the entrance for the purpose of checking age identification where possible there shall be only one point of ingress and egress when required the fence shall be a minimum of 4 feet high 2 underage persons prohibited no underage person as defined by statute shall be allowed to assist in the sale of fermented malt beverages or wine at any point of sale nor shall any underage person be allowed to loiter or linger in the area of any point of sale unless a request has been made by the organization and approved by common council in accordance with 125266 wis stats 3 posting of signs and licenses all organizations issued a temporary license shall post in a conspicuous location at the main point of sale and at all remote points of sale a sufficient number of signs stating that no fermented malt beverage shall be served to any underage person 4 licensed operator required a licensed operator shall be stationed at all points of sales at all times 5 waiver the common council may waive the requirements of this section due to the physical characteristics of the licensed site or the common council may impose additional requirements if it is deemed necessary 1b qualifications for licenses and permits cr #788 a natural persons licenses related to alcohol beverages issued to natural persons under this section may be issued only to persons who 1 do not have an arrest or conviction record subject to   and  wis stats 2 have been residents of this state continuously for at least one year prior to the date of filing the application for license except that a class b license may be issued to a person who has been a resident of the state continuously for 90 days prior to the date of the application 3 have attained the legal drinking age except that operators licenses may be issued to persons who have attained the age of 18 4 cr #591 have submitted proof under 776111 wis stats b criminal offenders  cr #489 no license or permit related to alcohol beverages may subject to   and  wis stats be issued under this section to any natural person who has been convicted of a felony unless the person has been duly pardoned c corporations  cr #489  am #591 no license or permit may be issued to any corporation unless the agent of the corporation appointed under 125046 wis stats and the officers and directors of the corporation meet the qualifications of pars a1 3 and 4 and b above except that the par a2 does not apply to agents d training course  cr #591 1 no operators license may be issued unless the applicant has successfully completed a responsible beverage server training course the responsible beverage server training course may be taken at any location that is offered by a vocational technical or adult education district which course conforms to curriculum guidelines specified by the board of vocational technical or adult education this requirement of successful completion of a beverage server training course does not apply if the applicant fulfills one of the following requirements a the person is renewing an operators license b within the past 2 years the person held a class a class b class a or class b license or permit or a managers or operators license c within the past 2 years the person has completed such a training course 2 the city clerk may issue a provisional operators license to a person who is enrolled in a training course under subpar 1 above for a period of 60 days the clerk shall revoke that provisional operators license if the applicant fails to successfully complete the course in which he or she enrolls there may be no renewal of officials shall review such application and inspect or cause to be inspected the premises to determine whether the applicant and the premises sought to be licensed comply with the regulations ordinances and laws applicable thereto and the applicants fitness for the trust to be imposed these officials shall furnish to the council in writing the information derived from such investigation no license or permit provided for in this section shall be issued without the approval of a majority of the council and no license shall be renewed without a reinspection of the premises and report as by the judiciary committees am #1697  #1505 m class b reserve license  cr #1301 1 issued under 125514a4 wis stats the initial issuance fee is $10000 this initial fee is in addition to any other fees
